snippet: The Afghans were on their way to a wedding in western Afghanistan when their van hit a roadside bomb, and most of the dead were women and children.
abstract: Roadside bomb in western Afghanistan kills 17 civilians, most of them women and children, as they traveled to a wedding; it was the third time in less than 10 days that a bomb claimed the lives of civilians.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Sharifullah Sahak contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: The Afghans were on their way to a wedding in western Afghanistan when their van hit a roadside bomb, and most of the dead were women and children.

headline.print_headline: Roadside Bomb Kills 17 Civilians in Afghanistan
